'''{{Pagename nd}}''' is a {{lc:Quest item}} in {{poe2}}.

##  Description 

{{Description |{{#var:description}}}}

##  Acquisition 

{{#arraymap: {{#var:location}}|;|x|x|\n}}

##  Usage 

* Having this item in your stash grants you access to [Dereo's lair](/dereosLair/), safe passage through the trio of thugs to [Delver's Row](/delversRow/), and allows you to use the lift to the [Undercroft](/undercroft/).

##  Trivia 

* While reading [Botaro](/botaro/)'s soul in the [Old City Overlook](/oldCityOverlook/), it mentions him having this coin on him, and that it would grant access to Dereo's hideout.
* While speaking to [Sedūzo](/seduzo/), she mentions that Botaro showed her the marked suolenet, commonly used as a token of Príncipi allegiance. As an RDC captain, this alarmed her, and she knew that she must have been dealing with a pirate. Botaro was dragged away after Sedūzo called the guards, and it is assumed that the marked coin was discovered on his person and confiscated as evidence by the overseer.
* Talking to [Dereo the Lean](/dereoTheLean/), he is surprised that you found one of his suolenets. You can comment that it came from a "...man who tried to make off with your money", referencing Botaro.

'''{{Pagename nd}}''' is a {{lc:Quest item}} in {{poe2}}.

== Description ==
{{Description |{{#var:description}}}}

== Acquisition ==
{{#arraymap: {{#var:location}}|;|x|x|\n}}

== Usage ==
* Having this item in your stash grants you access to [[Dereo's lair]], safe passage through the trio of thugs to [[Delver's Row]], and allows you to use the lift to the [[Undercroft]].

== Trivia ==
* While reading [[Botaro]]'s soul in the [[Old City Overlook]], it mentions him having this coin on him, and that it would grant access to Dereo's hideout.
* While speaking to [[Sedūzo]], she mentions that Botaro showed her the marked suolenet, commonly used as a token of Príncipi allegiance. As an RDC captain, this alarmed her, and she knew that she must have been dealing with a pirate. Botaro was dragged away after Sedūzo called the guards, and it is assumed that the marked coin was discovered on his person and confiscated as evidence by the overseer.
* Talking to [[Dereo the Lean]], he is surprised that you found one of his suolenets. You can comment that it came from a "...man who tried to make off with your money", referencing Botaro.
